3: 'She' isn't the goddess to whom this eternal dirge created by the waves lapping the shore is dedicated.
'Her' ending is preordained. In countless cycles, she is always imprisoned on this lone island. The shackles are now part of her soul.
As the tides ebb and flow, and as lives blossom and wither, the forgotten things return to oblivion.
Who has gazed at 'her' with sorrow in their eyes?
Who has brought 'her' to this place?
Who has cast a spell on 'her'?
And who has taken away a part of 'her'?
'She' was whole once, but then torn apart by time. After hundreds of years of horrible nightmares, time has lost all its meaning.
What keeps 'her' going? Does the present 'she' even exist?
No one can answer these questions.
Eventually, a variable appears in this never-changing cycle.
Who is also left stranded on this lone island?
